description: The LFAP agent or a LFAP client has tried to connect to all
servers in rsLfapStatsServerStaticTable and has failed.

event.Summary: Failed to connect to all LFAP servers

description: The value of sysUpTime when rsLfapStatsSessionUp
last changed state.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsSessionChangedAt

description: This is the number of FAILED TCP connections the LFAP agent
made to connect to a FAS.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsTcpConnectFails

description: When a LFAP client first drops messages due to no connected
server, send this event. No additional events are sent until
the value of rsLfapStatsSessionChangedAt value has
changed.

event.Summary: LFAP messages lost due to server not connected

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapLostMessage RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsSessionChangedAt t 31536000 RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsLostAt t 31536000 RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsSessionUp i 1

description: The value of sysUpTime when rsLfapStatsSessionUp
last changed state.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsSessionChangedAt

description: On the CCE, the sysUpTime when the LFAP agent last lost
trasmitted FAR/FUN messages. On the FAS, it would be the last
time when the server lost received FAR/FUN messages.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsLostAt

description: The current state of the TCP connection between the
LFAP agent on the CCE and an external server (FAS)
identified by rsLfapServerStaticIndex. If a connection
from the CCE is established with the FAS, then its value
would be true. Otherwise it would be false.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsSessionUp

description: Accounting data may be lost when the CCE queue reaches
capacity. rsLfapStatsSessionUp indicates the
typical case where there the connection to a FAS is lost.
A second case is where the rate of inserts into the
queue exceeds the rate at which the FAS is processing
them. This can be caused by flow control of the underlying
TCP session. Send only one rsLfapStatsQueueFull
notification per 1000 messages.

event.Summary: LFAP CCE queue reached capacity; messages dropped: $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapQueueFull RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsDropsInTxQueue c 9999 RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapMaxTxQueueSize i 9999 RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsSessionUp i 1

description: This object represents the number of messages dropped by the
LFAP agent in the transmitting queue for this FAS.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsDropsInTxQueue

description: Number of messages that can be queued for transmit before
messages are dropped.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapMaxTxQueueSize

description: The current state of the TCP connection between the
LFAP agent on the CCE and an external server (FAS)
identified by rsLfapServerStaticIndex. If a connection
from the CCE is established with the FAS, then its value
would be true. Otherwise it would be false.
variables.name: RIVERSTONE-LFAP-MIB::rsLfapStatsSessionUp
